subject: Learning
title: Inattentional Blindness
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Inattentional Blindness.

hook.text: In a famous experiment, half the viewers didn't notice a gorilla walk through a basketball game.

buildup.text: Participants were told to count basketball passes. They focused so hard they missed the obvious.

discovery.text: Inattentional blindness means focusing intensely on one thing makes you literally blind to others.

twist.text: It's not a flawâ€”it's a feature. The brain can't process everything, so it prioritizes ruthlessly.

climax.text: This explains why texting drivers miss stop signs and why magicians can fool anyone.

punchline.text: You don't see what you're not looking for.

quiz.question: What causes inattentional blindness?
options: Intense focus on one thing makes the brain blind to unexpected stimuli
A physical problem with the eyes
Only occurs in children under age 10
